title: Cover — Neon Pilgrimage
text: Neon gutters and street-prayers flicker as the pilgrimage gathers. You carry the league’s blessing and the weight of a chest that refuses every tool. Tonight is the last quiet before responsibility becomes miles.

text_variants.historian: Neon gutters and street-prayers flicker as the pilgrimage gathers, and you read each face like a ledger of vows. The chest refuses every tool, but the record already has a first line.
text_variants.smith: Neon gutters and street-prayers flicker as the pilgrimage gathers. You test the chest’s seams with your thumb and feel a craft made to refuse you. Tonight is the last quiet before miles demand answers.
text_variants.quartermaster: Neon gutters and street-prayers flicker as the pilgrimage gathers. You weigh the chest against rations and boots, already counting what it will cost to carry it. Tonight is the last quiet before the math turns merciless.

speaker: Belander
text: You paid for the table; I hauled the orb. Beat me and you can say you humbled a league veteran—if you can carry the story straight.

text_variants.bard: You paid for the table; I hauled the orb. Beat me and you can sing about humbling a league veteran—if your tune can carry the weight.
text_variants.infobroker: You paid for the table; I hauled the orb. Beat me and you’ll owe me a rumor worth the league’s pride—no cheap truths.
text_variants.quartermaster: You paid for the table; I hauled the orb. Beat me and I’ll admit you can count a win without counting the cost.

prompt: Before you leave, you gift Belander a token.
text: A leaving gift is not just courtesy here. It sets the tone of the road and becomes a story that follows your name.

choices.label: A sharpened dagger for fast hands
choices.desc: A fighter’s blessing; the night warms.

choices.label: A signed mace from a league legend
A tower shield painted with a meme

title: Workshop Monologue
text: Your tools hum in their rack, steady as old friends. The Super Naturals — Apex, Dedor, Theramous, Widjet — wait outside with the pilgrims and the chest. You have to decide what craft you bring to a road that tests more than hands.

text_variants.smith: Your tools hum in their rack, steady as old friends. The Super Naturals — Apex, Dedor, Theramous, Widjet — wait outside with the pilgrims and the chest. You rest a palm on the anvil and feel the road in its grain.
text_variants.architect: Your tools hum in their rack, steady as old friends. The Super Naturals — Apex, Dedor, Theramous, Widjet — wait outside with the pilgrims and the chest. You picture every bridge on the route and measure your responsibility by span.
text_variants.relicator: Your tools hum in their rack, steady as old friends. The Super Naturals — Apex, Dedor, Theramous, Widjet — wait outside with the pilgrims and the chest. You already hear the chest like a bell with a missing tone.

note: Each class nudges stats differently throughout Act 1 and Act 2.

title: Doorway Blessing
text: At the doorway, your mother presses a hand to your cheek and repeats the old words: return with everyone you love. You nod like it is possible, and the chest waits outside like a sleeping animal.

text_variants.leatherworker: At the doorway, your mother presses a hand to your cheek and repeats the old words: return with everyone you love. You feel every strap you stitched and wonder which one will fail first.
text_variants.alchemist: At the doorway, your mother presses a hand to your cheek and repeats the old words: return with everyone you love. You taste the oath like a tincture—bitter, necessary, measured in drops.
text_variants.bard: At the doorway, your mother presses a hand to your cheek and repeats the old words: return with everyone you love. You answer with a promise that sounds like a refrain you’re not sure you can hold.

title: Act 1 — Departure
text: You leave the neon district before dawn. The road is quiet, and the pilgrims are louder than they think—boots, whispers, the creak of the chest.

text_variants.cartographer: You leave the neon district before dawn. The road opens like a blank line, and every bootprint is a decision you have to chart.
text_variants.quartermaster: You leave the neon district before dawn. You count breath and supplies as the pilgrims talk, and every laugh sounds like a ration burned.
text_variants.historian: You leave the neon district before dawn. The road is quiet, and you are the only one listening to how the pilgrimage rewrites itself with each step.

prompt: Road danger: stormglass ravine.
text: The path is littered with stormglass shards that sing in the wind. The pilgrims hesitate, and the chest feels heavier when no one speaks.

text_variants.cartographer: The path is littered with stormglass shards that sing in the wind. Your map shows three lines through it, all of them risky, all of them yours.
text_variants.leatherworker: The path is littered with stormglass shards that sing in the wind. You eye the straps, the boots, the thin places where a cut becomes a story.
text_variants.alchemist: The path is littered with stormglass shards that sing in the wind. You smell old lightning and wonder what it does to blood.

choices.label: Bridge the gap and push through
Camp and wait for the wind to settle

prompt_variants.quartermaster: Camp night: count supplies, then count people.
prompt_variants.relicator: Camp night: listen for the chest between the cracks of the fire.

prompt: Waystation traders offer help—for a price.
text: A caravan crew offers supplies and gossip if you share the chest’s story. They want leverage, not legend.

text_variants.quartermaster: A caravan crew offers supplies and gossip if you share the chest’s story. You hear the price in their politeness.

prompt_variants.leatherworker: Camp night: wind tests every seam.

prompt_variants.historian: Camp night: the old stories sound less like comfort.

prompt: A cracked sky-bridge blocks the pass.
text: The pilgrims argue. The bridge groans under the chest, and the void listens.

text_variants.architect: The pilgrims argue. You read the bridge like a sick bone and count where it will fail.

note: Choose who to speak with as the road shifts into giantland. The firelight makes everyone honest in different ways.

title: Arrival
text: Giantland rises like a wall of storm and stone. A shaman waits at the threshold, and every pilgrim suddenly walks like they’re being weighed.

text_variants.historian: Giantland rises like a wall of storm and stone. You feel the weight of old treaties in the air as a shaman waits at the threshold.
text_variants.relicator: Giantland rises like a wall of storm and stone. The shaman’s presence prickles at the edge of your craft, like a spell watching back.
text_variants.cartographer: Giantland rises like a wall of storm and stone. Your map shrinks in your hand, and the road becomes a cliff.

prompt: The shaman offers a blessing.
text: The blessing is a ritual of safety and consequence. The pilgrims look to you, and the shaman watches how you carry the chest.

text_variants.relicator: The blessing is a ritual of safety and consequence. You feel the pattern in the air and the cost hidden in the cadence.
text_variants.historian: The blessing is a ritual of safety and consequence. You hear old bargaining in it, an oath that outlives the speaker.
text_variants.bard: The blessing is a ritual of safety and consequence. The shaman’s words are a song without melody, and everyone waits for your verse.

choices.label: Accept the blessing
choices.desc: Morale rises; the rite binds you.

choices.label: Decline the blessing
choices.desc: You keep control, but the party worries.

prompt: The proving trial begins.
text: To reach the blessing stone, you must prove your craft to the giants. They do not want spectacle; they want truth.

text_variants.smith: To reach the blessing stone, you must prove your craft to the giants. You feel every eye on your hands, not your reputation.
text_variants.historian: To reach the blessing stone, you must prove your craft to the giants. They test whether you honor the story behind the work.
text_variants.architect: To reach the blessing stone, you must prove your craft to the giants. You read their trial like a structure meant to reveal a flaw.

choices.label: Show a daring flourish
choices.desc: Impresses the giants, but risks wounds.

title: Blessing Stone
text: The shaman lays a hand on the chest. The pilgrims stand in a circle as the stone hums with a promise you can’t yet translate.

text_variants.relicator: The shaman lays a hand on the chest. The stone hums with a pattern you can almost echo, like a spell missing its final note.
text_variants.alchemist: The shaman lays a hand on the chest. The stone hums with a reaction you cannot bottle, and you feel the cost in your teeth.
text_variants.historian: The shaman lays a hand on the chest. The stone hums with a promise old enough to have consequences.

title: Interlude — Giant City
text: The pilgrims settle their affairs with the giant elders. You walk the city alone, letting its scale recalibrate your breath and your idea of smallness.

text_variants.infobroker: The pilgrims settle their affairs with the giant elders. You walk the city alone, tracking who watches and who pretends not to.
text_variants.historian: The pilgrims settle their affairs with the giant elders. You walk the city alone, hearing a history older than the stones.

prompt: A giant market beckons.
text: You have a short window to barter before the return journey. The market feels like a test with too many judges.

text_variants.quartermaster: You have a short window to barter before the return journey. The market feels like a ledger that wants to be balanced in blood.
text_variants.bard: You have a short window to barter before the return journey. The market feels like a stage where the wrong line can cost you a month.
text_variants.infobroker: You have a short window to barter before the return journey. Every stall hides a contact if you know how to ask.

title: Leaving the City
text: Jeffery returns with the pilgrims. The chest feels warmer, as if it listened while you wandered and chose to say nothing.

text_variants.relicator: Jeffery returns with the pilgrims. The chest feels warmer, as if it caught a fragment of the city’s old spells.
text_variants.quartermaster: Jeffery returns with the pilgrims. The chest feels warmer, and you wonder how much heat costs to carry.
text_variants.historian: Jeffery returns with the pilgrims. The chest feels warmer, as if it absorbed a story you can’t yet write down.
